summary: This bill, the "Addressing Anti-Competitive Health Care Contract Clauses Act," mandates a Government Accountability Office (GAO) study on the effects of anticompetitive clauses in contracts between health insurers and healthcare providers. The study will evaluate the impact of clauses like anti-steering, anti-tiering, all-or-nothing, and gag clauses on healthcare consolidation, consumer prices, and access. It will also assess the Federal Trade Commission and Department of Justice's enforcement capabilities and recommend potential legislative or administrative actions. The bill defines the aforementioned clause types and requires a report to relevant congressional committees.
